quest.name: The Flame in the Abyss
journal: An anger you know all too well smolders within Sidurgu.

House Caulignont has long held strong ties with the Ishgardian Orthodox Church, allowing many of her sons and daughters to rise to great prominence within the clergy. Countess Ystride de Caulignont was poised to do the same, until she learned of her husband's heresy. When confronted, he proudly confessed to having consumed dragon blood for decades before draining a vial to complete his transformation and murder his wife. Though he was slain before he could do so, he nevertheless succeeded in tearing his family apart, for when the countess realized that his tainted blood had been passed on to their daughter, Rielle, she chose to confine her to a cell for fear of what the girl might become.

Now fully aware of his foes' fanatical nature, Sidurgu would seize upon any advantage for the coming battle. Recalling the ancient dragon's words, he thinks to seek out the “tiny beings” who know a better way. He has no idea who they might be, but you have a sneaking suspicion that you do...

You summon Sidurgu and Rielle to Moghome and introduce them to Moggie, the second-most well-informed moogle in the village. However, rather than engaging the moogle, the normally reserved Rielle erupts, berating Sidurgu for his obsession with the darkness and his treatment of her. Moggie, believing that she has insight into the “flame in the abyss,” bids you and Sidurgu gather pomwort, while she and the other moogles look after Rielle.
Though the purpose is hardly clear to you, you gather pomwort as Moggie requested. Return to the moogle and present to her your bounty.

Having completed your first “trial,” Moggie bids you undertake a second. You and Sidurgu are to cull tulihands on the road to Asah. A curious trial, to be sure, but surely there is a method to the moogle's madness...
As you slay tulihand after tulihand, you begin to wonder if this is all simply pointless busywork. Join Sidurgu in Asah and see if he shares your suspicions.

In a shocking and altogether baffling turn of events, the moogles of Moghome reveal that they have kidnapped Rielle. Sidurgu predictably flies into a rage, and together you set about beating the moogles senseless. Afterwards, your comrade demands the return of his charge once more, only for the moogles to ask why. Sidurgu cites his oath as a dark knight, prompting the gathered moogles to burst into song, extolling the virtues of love. Speechless, the dark knight turns away, only to find Rielle safe and sound in the company of Moggie. At the moogle's behest, Rielle voices her feelings and accuses Sidurgu of helping her only to further his own quest for vengeance against the Temple Knights. After a moment, he acknowledges that she speaks true, but reminds her that they will not survive the coming trial without each other's aid. He states that what happens afterwards will be her decision, and his words seem to mollify the young girl.

Declaring your time spent in Moghome to have been an utter waste of time, Sidurgu returns to Ishgard together with Rielle. As you watch them depart, however, you are not entirely certain that you agree...

In the Forgotten Knight, Sidurgu reveals to you that he was among those first refugees to Ishgard, and that he watched helplessly as Temple Knights executed his parents without cause. He too would have died that day, were it not for the intervention of a dark knight, who would then become his mentor. Though he claimed to embrace noble ideals, he confesses that it was likely nothing more than an excuse to indulge in vengeance. Though he now believes himself unworthy to defend Rielle, he knows that she has no one else but you and him. For one last battle, at least, he will stand at her side...

※The next dark knight quest will be available from Sidurgu upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Keep watch for tulihands in the Landlord Colony.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Mountaintop Diplomacy.”

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: It took considerable effort, but at last I have learned the whole truth. Attend me, Forename. You have a right to know.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: For countless generations, the sons and daughters of House Caulignont have pledged themselves to the church, so devoted to the faith they are.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Many rose to positions of great prominence within the clergy, and for a time, Countess Ystride de Caulignont was poised to do the same. And when she and her husband celebrated the birth of their firstborn, the futures of the house seemed brighter than ever.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: That is, until years later, when the inquisitors came. Information gleaned during an interrogation had implicated her husband as a heretic.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: When the countess confronted him with these allegations, he brought a vial to his lips and completed his transformation─one he proudly declared was decades in the making.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...The Temple Knights slew him as he tried to rip out her throat.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Afterwards, she had Rielle locked away in the deepest cell she could find.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Madness. What monster thinks to find absolution in her daughter's death!?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't go! She'll kill you!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: She'll kill us anyway if we don't! I...I know what I'm doing, Rielle. I have a plan...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Forename, recall you the dragon's words when we told her of our dark arts? She said that there were “tiny beings” who know a better way.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: If they can teach us how to harness the abyss, mayhap we can stand against Lady Ystride and her minions. Unfortunately, I haven't the foggiest who these “tiny beings” might be...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I shall make inquiries, but I do not expect to learn much. If you uncover aught of interest, pray send word.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Right, then. A plan.

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't one of the new visitors from below! Are you searching for something? If so, just ask! I pride myself on being the second-most well-informed moogle here, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: ...My, that's a rather grim way of living, isn't it? I can't say I've ever heard of knights so infatuated with “darkness”!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: However, I think I might know why she bade you visit us. Go ahead and fetch your friends. We have an awful lot to talk about, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Welcome to Moghome, kupo! The little one must be Rielle, which makes the big one Sid, right?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Yes. I presume you are one of the “tiny beings” of whom the dragon spoke.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Rielle, say something to the moogle.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Rielle.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Rielle!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...I'm sick of this charade.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: You tell me to talk, but then you refuse to listen. You tell me you're doing this for me, but then you go on about the “darkness” and the “abyss”!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Am I supposed to be grateful when you come back covered in blood? When I put you back together so you can do it again!?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: You drag me to halfway across the world so you can discover a new way to kill yourself, and you tell me it's for my sake!?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Why are we here, Sidurgu!? Tell me the real reason!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Rielle, I...of course it's for your sake!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Well, you've certainly had a lot of practice saying it, haven't you.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: I'm sure the next fair maiden will appreciate it!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: What are you saying!? It's not like that, Rielle!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: And you! Say something, damn you!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Ahhh, I think I'm beginning to understand this whole “darkness” concept, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Harnessing the power of your emotions or some such, yes? I'm reminded of an ancient legend about a moogle named Mog─rather simple name, I know, but those were simpler times, kupo! Anyway, Mog had a penchant for dancing, and─

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Wait, wait. What does dancing have to do with the dark arts?

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Everything, kupo! Everything!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: The point is, your master was absolutely right when he told you to “submit to the flame.” You just never figured out what he meant by it.

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: But better late than never, kupo! Master Moggie will show you the way! First, you two dark knights will need to pull four sprigs of pomwort each. Hop to it, kupo!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I fail to see what purpose this serves, but fine. You will have your precious pomwort.

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Oh, and Rielle can stay here with us while you're away!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Let's go, Forename.

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: No one will be harnessing the darkness or the abyss or whatever else unless you bring me plenty of pomwort first, kupo!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...Look after him, will you?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Strength is pain. Strength is suffering. Strength is sacrifice... Gah! Sod this!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Remind me again why we came back?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: This doesn't feel right...

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: There you are, darkest dark one of the dark! Have you brought my pomwort?

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Very nice, very nice, kupo! That must've kept you busy for a while!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: For your next trial, you must, er...you must cull tulihands, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Rather a lot of them have been sighted on the road to Asah. If you wait there long enough, they're sure to show up, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Rielle? Oh, you needn't worry about her! She's off playing with some friends of mine, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Just focus on the trial, and wait for me in Asah when you're finished!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: When you and Sid have finished culling those tulihands, meet me in Asah, and I'll give you your next trial, kupo!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...What in the hells are we doing, Forename?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: What could moogles possibly know about mastering the dark arts?

dialogue.name: TANKMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: (-???-)Mwahaha! Foolish fools!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Right, then. What's all this?

dialogue.name: TANKMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: While you two were busy gathering pomwort and slaying tulihands, we kidnapped Rielle, kupo! Mwahaha!

dialogue.name: HEALERMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: Oh yeeesss, kupo! We've had so much fun playing together! So much fun indeed, kupo!

dialogue.name: TANKMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: So much fun that we thought we might keep her here forever! Mwahaha!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: You wouldn't dare.

dialogue.name: HEALERMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: If you don't believe us, go and look! You'll never find her, kupo! Not in a million years!

dialogue.name: TANKMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: Mwahaha! She's ours, kupo! You'll never see her again! Mwahaha!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: You...you furry little shites!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Give her back to me, now! Or I swear, I will kill every last one of you and burn your village to cinders!

dialogue.name: TANKMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: Yeowch! Y-You could really hurt someone, carrying on like that, kupo!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: That's the bloody point! Now tell me where she is if you want to live!

dialogue.name: TANKMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: W-Wait, wait!

dialogue.name: HEALERMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: Why do you want her back so badly, kupo!?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: What kind of question is that!? You kidnapped her!

dialogue.name: HEALERMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: But you don't seem to like having her around that much anyway, right? She's just a burden to you. So why do you care what happens to her?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I...I swore an oath. To protect her. That's what we dark knights do...

dialogue.name: ATTACKERMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text: You think that will give you strength enough to protect her!? Duty and honor? I'll tell you what you need, kupo!

dialogue.name: BUFFERMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text:
Whence comes true strength to defend the meek?♪
Is it honor? Is it justice? How blaaand!♪

dialogue.name: BUFFERMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text:
Could it be that the darkness is born of a light?♪
A flame burning for another? How graaand!♪

dialogue.name: BUFFERMOOGLE02063
dialogue.text:
'Tis love! 'Tis love!♪
All-powerful, shining loooooove!♪

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: ...Rather blunt, I'll admit, but subtlety doesn't seem to be your strong suit, kupo.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Rielle!

dialogue.name: MOGGIE
dialogue.text: Well, here we are. Go on, Rielle. Say your piece.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...I know you and Fray were trying to do right by your master─that you came to my defense because you believed that's what he would've wanted. And I know you only did that because you believed it would make you stronger, because all you truly care about is killing more Temple Knights!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: I've seen how you look at them─how you curse them under your breath. How you relish every opportunity to cut them down. So don't tell me that it's all been for me! Don't tell me that Fray died for me!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Everything I have done, I have done for my mother and my father. For my master, and yes...most of all, for me.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I haven't been honest with you, nor with myself...and for that I am sorry. I will stand for you in this coming trial, but after... What happens after will be your decision.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Good. That's a promise.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: For what it's worth, I'm sorry it had to come to this.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Furry little bastards had us fooled, eh?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Shame their wisdom is bollocks. I mean really now, love? That's what you need to harness the abyss?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I mean, I suppose there's something to be said for caring deeply for your charge, but... No. No, I will not give those cretins even a sliver of credit. This was an utter waste of time, and that's that.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Still...I am glad to have come to an understanding with Rielle.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: We should return to Ishgard. The hour of the trial draws close.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Come along, Rielle.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...It needed to be said.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...I was about Rielle's age when I came to Ishgard. My parents, they...they said we would find a better life here.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: When the Temple Knights we had shown mercy returned, they let us choose the order in which we would die. That would be their mercy to us, they declared.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I watched my parents kneel in the dirt. “Look away,” they said. But I could not.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: At last, when it was my turn, I knelt and prepared to follow them into death. I closed my eyes...but when I opened them, a man in black stood before me, hand outstretched. And so I took it.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text:
“Defend the meek.” “Punish the wicked.”
...Mayhap it was all but a convenient excuse to indulge in vengeance.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: She deserves better than me. But there is no one else...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: One more battle, Forename. Let's see it done.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Mayhap in this final battle I can serve as my master intended...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Give her back to me! Give...her...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Mwahaha...ha...ha...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Oh my, that's more than I...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Bit much if you ask me, kupo...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forever...forever...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: This...this isn't what I...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Keep crying, kupo! Keep...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ugh... This better be worth it...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Mwahaha! Do your worst, kupo!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You miss your Rielle, kupo! Well, too bad! She's our Rielle now, kupo!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'm going to rip that pom off your head and shove it down your godsdamned throat!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Our turn, kupo!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Give her back to me! Give her back!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You just don't get it, do you, kupo? She's gone! Forever! Mwahaha!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: It doesn't matter how hard you fight, kupo! You're never going to see her again!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: What? Are you gonna cry now, kupo? Go on then! Cry! Cry for me, kupo!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I think he is, kupo! Look!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: GRAAARRRGGGH! DIE, DAMN YOU, DIE!
